es.csic.iiia.nsm.config

Class Goal

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.csic.iiia.nsm.config.Goal
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Gcols, GComplaints

    public abstract class Goal
extends java.lang.Object
    The goal of a system. The Norm Synthesis Machine uses system goals to perform conflict detection. The detection of a conflict is always performed based on a system goal. A particular situation may be conflictive from the point of view of a particular goal, while it may not be conflictive with respect to another goal.

    As an example, consider a traffic scenario where travelling cars stand for agents, and there are two system goals: (1) to avoid collisions between cars, and (2) to avoid traffic jams. Consider now a transition of views in which all the cars remain stopped. From the point of view of goal 1, there is no conflict since there are no collisions. However, from the point of view of goal 2 the situation in the view transition is conflictive, since all cars remain stopped and it represents a traffic jam.

    Author:
    "Javier Morales (jmorales@iiia.csic.es)"
